title: Megan Mullally took leave of absence from Will & Grace amid reported friction with Debra Messing
text:
Megan Mullally took a leave of absence from Will & Grace, resulting in two missed shows.

The 60-year-old actress, who plays the role of Karen Walker on the NBC comedy, took the leave amid the show's last season, TV Line reported Thursday.

Mullally's relationship with co-star Debra Messing, 51, has come into question as of late, as the pair no longer follow one another on Instagram, nor have they been situated in the same promotional shots for the show's social media.

The latest: Megan Mullally, 60, took a leave of absence from Will & Grace, resulting in two missed shows, as her relationship with co-star Debra Messing, 51, has come into question as of late

As for the show's other principle players, Mullally doesn't follow Sean Hayes on the social media site either, but remains following Eric McCormack.

Mullally looked to be in good spirits as she took to social media on Thursday promoting the show in multiple clips.

She wrote, 'Okay more like 19 minutes...! Will&Grace premieres tonight at 9:30 EST.'

McCormack downplayed the reports of on-set tension between the stars speaking with US in September.

'It seems crazy. It is crazy!' he said. 'I think people worried about that entirely too much. 'The four of us get along like a house on fire. We always have.'

The latest: Mullally looked to be in good spirits as she took to social media on Thursday promoting the show

Stalwarts: (L-R) Mullally, Eric McCormack, Messing and Sean Hayes posed with one another in June 2018 in LA

The series first ran on NBC from 1998 thru 2005 and was subsequently rebooted in 2017. NBC announced this past July that the reboot would be wrapping up in the show's 11th season.

'The impact and legacy of Will & Grace simply can’t be overstated, both as a true game-changer in the portrayal of the LGBTQ community and as one of the finest comedies in television history,' NBC Entertainment co-chairmen George Cheeks and Paul Telegdy said in a statement. 'When NBC had the opportunity to reconnect this amazing cast and creative team, we jumped at the chance.'

Messing said in an Instagram post that the show 'decided it was the right time' to call it a day.

'We were so lucky to have the opportunity to reunite and do the show AGAIN,' she wrote. 'It was only supposed to be 10 episodes, but because of you, the fans, it has turned into 3 YEARS. What a miracle.

'We are all committed to making this season the best ever, and to wrap up the story of Will, Grace, Jack and Karen in a way that feels meaningful and right.'

Will & Grace airs Thursdays on NBC at 9:30/8:30c.
